questions.question_text:
A sales manager submitted a new feature request to the product owner, and the request was added to the product backlog. During the sprint planning meeting, the team struggles over which algorithm is the most efficient one to use. The team thinks that some development work is needed to decide.

What should the project manager do?

choices.D: Create a new item in the sprint backlog to determine the appropriate algorithm.
choices.A: Ask the scrum master to choose an algorithm based on the pros and cons of each option.
choices.B: Request a meeting with the product owner to help clarify the user story.
choices.C: Invite the sales manager to the next sprint meeting to clarify requirements.

discussion.content:

questions.question_text:
A hybrid project has just started, which will result in a new technology that could disrupt the market if well accepted by the public. The product requires health and safety approvals from the government. As this is an innovative solution, the sponsor and product owner are unsure if it will be accepted by the public.

What is the appropriate flow for product development?

choices.A: Complete development with all functionalities in perfect condition prior to demonstrating to stakeholders to ensure a great first impression.
choices.B: Complete development for the must-have functionalities only prior to demonstration in order to fail fast and get early feedback.
choices.C: Complete development for each sprint and demonstrate the product increment to internal stakeholders and the government, without engaging other external stakeholders.
choices.D: Complete development for must-have functionalities only and demonstrate it to a focus group, but wait until all development is complete to demonstrate it to the government.

In a marine construction project, the project manager is informed by the marine authority that the work permit will not be issued until certain environmental reinforcement work has been completed. After reviewing the project management plan, the reinforcement work is not included in the project scope.

What should the project manager do?

questions.question_text:
An organization is undergoing an agile transformation. The executive leadership team is concerned that they will lose control over the scope of the project.

What should the project manager, who is responsible for this project, do to mitigate this risk?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Propose a governance model that empowers the teams while providing the necessary oversight to the executive leadership team

Selected Answer: D
D semble être la plus appropriée car elle cherche à équilibrer la responsabilité des équipes avec la nécessité de supervision de l'équipe de direction, tout en respectant les principes agiles. Cela permettrait d'atténuer les craintes de perte de contrôle tout en favorisant la réussite de la transformation agile.

choices.A: Allocate time to mentor the team.
choices.B: Request the project management office (PMO) for a team of mentors.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Allocate time to mentor the team

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: A
Mentoring provides direct and personal support to team members, helping them understand and adapt to the hybrid approach. This one-on-one or small group interaction can address specific concerns and facilitate a deeper understanding of agile practices. A mentor helps build trust within the team by fostering open communication and collaboration. As team members feel more supported and confident, they are more likely to work together effectively. Therefore, allocating time to mentor the team directly addresses the immediate need for building a collaborative working environment and is the most practical and impactful step the project manager can take.

Selected Answer: C
L'identification des lacunes en matière de formation permettra au chef de projet de comprendre les besoins individuels des membres de l'équipe en termes de compétences et de connaissances. Cela lui permettra ensuite de planifier et de mettre en œuvre des sessions de formation appropriées pour combler ces lacunes, renforçant ainsi les compétences de l'équipe dans un environnement de travail hybride.

Why not A?

For a project manager working with a team transitioning to a hybrid approach and needing to promote collaboration, the most appropriate course of action is to:

A. Allocate time to mentor the team.

Mentoring the team is an essential part of fostering collaboration, especially when the team is adapting to new methods such as a hybrid approach. By allocating time to mentor the team, the project manager can guide them through the changes, provide support, answer questions, and help them adjust to new ways of working. This hands-on approach can improve the team's understanding of the new approach and encourage more cohesive and effective teamwork.
